feeds.name: APT Groups and Operations
feeds.description: A spreadsheet containing information and intelligence about APT groups, operations and tactics.

feeds.name: Binary Defense IP Banlist
feeds.description: Binary Defense Systems Artillery Threat Intelligence Feed and IP Banlist Feed.

feeds.name: BGP Ranking
feeds.description: Ranking of ASNs having the most malicious content.

feeds.name: Botnet Tracker
feeds.description: Tracks several active botnets.

feeds.name: BOTVRIJ.EU
feeds.description: Botvrij.eu provides different sets of open source IOCs that you can use in your security devices to detect possible malicious activity.

feeds.name: BruteForceBlocker
feeds.description: BruteForceBlocker is a perl script that monitors a server's sshd logs and identifies brute force attacks, which it then uses to automatically configure firewall blocking rules and submit those IPs back to the project site.

feeds.name: CertStream
feeds.description: Real-time certificate transparency log update stream. See SSL certificates as they're issued in real time.

feeds.name: CI Army List
feeds.description: A subset of the commercial CINS Score list, focused on poorly rated IPs that are not currently present on other threatlists.

feeds.name: Cisco Umbrella
feeds.description: Probable Whitelist of the top 1 million sites resolved by Cisco Umbrella (was OpenDNS).

feeds.name: Feodo Tracker
feeds.description: The Feodo Tracker abuse.ch tracks the Feodo trojan.

feeds.name: FireHOL IP Lists
feeds.description: 400+ publicly available IP Feeds analysed to document their evolution, geo-map, age of IPs, retention policy, overlaps. The site focuses on cyber crime (attacks, abuse, malware).

feeds.name: GreyNoise
feeds.description: GreyNoise collects and analyzes data on Internet-wide scanning activity. It collects data on benign scanners such as Shodan.io, as well as malicious actors like SSH and telnet worms.

feeds.name: MalwareBazaar
feeds.description: MalwareBazaar is a project from abuse.ch with the goal of sharing malware samples with the infosec community, AV vendors and threat intelligence providers.

feeds.name: Malware-Traffic-Analysis
feeds.description: This blog focuses on network traffic related to malware infections. Contains traffic analysis exercises, tutorials, malware samples, pcap files of malicious network traffic, and technical blog posts with observations.

feeds.name: OpenPhish Feeds
feeds.description: OpenPhish receives URLs from multiple streams and analyzes them using its proprietary phishing detection algorithms. There are free and commercial offerings available.

feeds.name: PhishTank
feeds.description: PhishTank delivers a list of suspected phishing URLs. Their data comes from human reports, but they also ingest external feeds where possible. It's a free service, but registering for an API key is sometimes necessary.

feeds.name: Talos
feeds.description: Cisco Talos Intelligence Group is one of the largest commercial threat intelligence teams in the world, comprised of world-class researchers, analysts and engineers. These teams are supported by unrivaled telemetry and sophisticated systems to create accurate, rapid and actionable threat intelligence for Cisco customers, products and services.

feeds.name: ThreatFox
feeds.description: ThreatFox is a free platform from abuse.ch with the goal of sharing indicators of compromise (IOCs) associated with malware with the infosec community, AV vendors and threat intelligence providers.

feeds.name: URLhaus
feeds.description: URLhaus is a project from abuse.ch with the goal of sharing malicious URLs that are being used for malware distribution.

feeds.name: Krebs on Security
feeds.description: Brian Krebs' blog covering cybersecurity news and investigations.

feeds.name: The Hacker News
feeds.description: Cybersecurity news and analysis site.

feeds.name: Bleeping Computer
feeds.description: Information security and technology news site.

feeds.name: Dark Reading
feeds.description: Cybersecurity news and information.

feeds.name: The Record
feeds.description: Cybersecurity news from Recorded Future.
